1.text: Place a pan on the stove, heating it on medium heat.

2.text: Add some oil or butter to the pan as it gets warm.

3.text: Allow the pan to warm up until the butter/oil is hot, but not browning.

4.text: Break the first egg into a small dish or bowl and pour it in, or crack the egg right in the pan.

5.text: Cook the eggs, undisturbed, until the clear edges turn white.

6.text: Cover the pan and lower the heat once the edges have turned white.

7.text: Observe the hardness of the yolk by lifting the pan lid and gently poking it with your finger.

8.text: Lift the egg out of the pan with a quick, firm slide of the spatula.

9.text: Fry your egg in hot oil for a decadent, golden brown crust and runny yolk.

10.text: Flip eggs halfway through to make them over-easy.

11.text: Serve an egg with toast for a simple breakfast.

12.text: Serve a fried egg over leftovers to make a filling meal.

13.text: Place a fried egg on sandwiches or burgers for a rich, protein filled option.
